  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team

title: Automobile Sales Executive
tagsAndSkills: Sales,Automobile Components,Auto Ancillary,Automotive Sales,parts sales,Filed Work,Four Wheeler,Customer Relationship

placeholders.label: Mumbai Suburbs, Navi Mumbai, Mumbai (All Areas)

jobDescription:
Greetings from O3Hire...!!


Team O3Hire is providing staffing and Recruitment services in various sectors like Automobile/Auto Ancillary, Engineering, Retail, Hospitality, Facility Management, Hotels, Restaurants, Banking, FMCG's, Information Technology, Management Sector, Manufacturing, Power & Energy, Telecom etc. Our endeavour is to partner you in hiring the best Talent.


As an Automobile Sales Executive, your role involves connecting with potential customers, understanding their preferences, and guiding them through the car-buying process. Heres a concise job description for this position:


Job Description

Role Overview: An Automobile Sales Executive serves as the primary point of contact between the dealership and customers. Your mission is to sell and promote a range of vehicles while ensuring exceptional customer satisfaction.

Responsibilities:

  • Greet customers arriving at the dealership.
  • Accompany customers on test drives.
  • Collect necessary documentation beforehand.
  • Negotiate vehicle prices and trade-in values..
  • Strive to meet sales targets.
  • Provide outstanding customer service throughout the sales process.
  • Address customer concerns and inquiries.

Qualifications and Skills:

  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Knowledge of automotive features, specifications, and financing options.
  • Ability to build rapport with customers.
  • Sales-oriented mindset and a passion for automobiles.

Inhand Salary : 15000-25000 + (Incentive, Allowance, Extra Benefits)

Hurry up...!! Apply at : kamal.o3hire@gmail.com

title: Specialist Credit Risk Policy Manager | Consumer Loan (AVP)
tagsAndSkills: Risk policy,Credit card,Credit Risk Management,Consumer Loan,Credit Risk,Rcsa,Credit Risk Modelling,Scorecard

ambitionBoxData.Title: Way To Go Consulting Reviews by Employees

jobDescription:
Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Manage policy / processes for mainly Personal loans for the consumer retail portfolio pan India
  • Assist in the preparation & implementation of product programs
  • Facilitate regular asset quality reviews with provision of analytics insights to identify risks/ opportunities and recommend relevant actions
  • Ensure credit policies and program risk acceptance criteria are reviewed regularly, with timely updates for proactive adaptation to changes in legal /regulatory requirements, business strategies, market environment or portfolio performance
  • Drive portfolio management initiatives through the credit cycle management framework by working in partnership with product managers, credit systems team, credit operations team and collection team  
  • Work in partnership with credit systems support team to implement key credit policy criteria in relevant credit acceptance & evaluation systems 
  • Escalate on timely basis significant risk issues to business management for taking appropriate remedial actions
  • Ensure timely completion of RCSAs including appropriate action plans to address identified control gaps
  • Ensure issues/action plans arising from Risk & Control Self-Assessments, risk events, KRIs, regulatory inspections or other risk issues are properly followed up

title: Assistant Manager - Engineering
tagsAndSkills: Engineering Management,Team Management,Maintenance Engineering,Preventive Maintenance,Maintenance Planning,Team Leading,Leadership,Preventive
jobDescription:
Responsibilities:

  1. Effectively delegate any maintenance issues to be resolved on each shift to the right skills in the team, planning and managing effective works.
  2. Adhere to daily and weekly checks to ensure smooth operation of company.
  3. Develop a Planned Preventative Maintenance (PPM) schedule, ensure full preventative maintenance is carried out, plan in missed maintenance activities, and lead the team to deliver effectively.
  4. Prepare a predictive and preventive maintenance plan and SOP for all the machines. Schedule both internal and external work(s) maximizing planned down time and reducing unplanned downtime.
  5. Manage the team to ensure machine availability, reactively managing dysfunctional machinery with the Shift management.
  6. Ensure routine calibration and maintenance requirements of a variety of electro-mechanical, hydraulic and pneumatic systems are undertaken.
  7. Ensure that designated buildings, plant and facilities are fit for purpose and to provide proactive support/solutions when required.
  8. Develop clear accountability for maintenance material spend combined with a strategy to manage expenditure.
  9. Manage systems and equipment data storage and maintain high levels of standards and accuracy.
  10. Manage the process of the introduction of new machinery, plant and equipment from drawing up the specification, to managing suppliers through to full installation in collaboration with all relevant parties.
  11. Manage the process of disposal of obsolete machinery, plant and equipment from gaining agreement to write off to physically removing it and its safe and lawful disposal.
  12. Attend various meetings and action/communicate instructions. Undertake continuous training and development. Perform root cause analysis and resolve problems.
  13. Identify improvement opportunities within the organization. Provide technical expertise to the team.
  14. Identify and deploy the technical skill sets, resource levels and system.
  15. Manage, coach and develop a high performing Maintenance team that meets agreed objectives and which delivers best practice results, added value and continuous improvements.
  16. Manage and lead the team, ensuring adequate staffing levels. Monitor the completion of tasks and ensure good performance and record on appropriate systems.
  17. Review, implement and update company records e.g. training matrices, performance reviews, and risk assessments.
  18. Monitors utility costs and conducts energy analyses to identify opportunities for cost savings or system performance improvements. Ensures up-grades and/or modifications are implemented.
  19. Monitor and assess staff work performance on an ongoing basis and provide performance feedback as needed, including completing formal employee performance reviews, and developing and carrying-out corrective action plans to improve worker performance.
  20. Oversee subordinate staff development activities, including providing training as needed. Assist in the setup of ventilation, refrigeration and other systems and conduct repairs when necessary
  21. Inspect and oversee facilities to resolve problems
  22. Develop and maintain a planning and scheduling routine and preventive maintenance of equipment, prioritizing and estimating work and technical assistance when developing job plans.

Desired profile of the candidate:

Minimum 10 - 12 Year Experience in Engineering - Pharmaceutical .

title: QC Executive/ Sr. Executive ( For Rabale and Vasai)
jobDescription:
Testing, Inspection & Analysis

Key Responsibilities:

Quality Testing:

Conduct and supervise routine quality testing of raw materials, in-process materials, and finished products.
Utilize advanced laboratory equipment and techniques to ensure the accuracy and reliability of test results.
Documentation and Reporting:

Maintain comprehensive and accurate records of all test results, procedures, and deviations.
Prepare, review, and approve QC documentation, including certificates of analysis and quality reports.
Compliance and Audits:

Ensure all QC processes adhere to SOPs, industry regulations (e.g., ISO, GMP), and company standards.
Participate in and support internal and external audits, providing necessary documentation and addressing any findings.
